question: Are there any common sustainability topics between Industrial Machinery & Goods and Iron & Steel Producers industries? If so, how do their reporting requirements differ?
optionA: Both industries cover Energy Management, but Industrial Machinery & Goods requires percentage grid electricity and renewable energy, while Iron & Steel Producers includes total fuel consumed, percentage coal, and natural gas.
optionB: Both industries cover Greenhouse Gas Emissions, but Industrial Machinery & Goods focuses on fuel economy, while Iron & Steel Producers details emissions reduction plans.
optionC: Both industries cover Water Management, but Industrial Machinery & Goods focuses on water recycling, while Iron & Steel Producers focuses on water stress regions.
optionD: Both industries cover Supply Chain Management, but Industrial Machinery & Goods focuses on raw material sourcing, while Iron & Steel Producers focuses on supplier engagement.
optionE: Both industries cover Emissions Management, but Industrial Machinery & Goods focuses on nitrogen oxides, while Iron & Steel Producers focuses on carbon dioxide.
